message.content: This question requires some knowledge about seed dispersal and the role of animals in the tree reproduction process. Squirrels are known to play the role of seed scatterers. When they collect and bury nuts, they often forget where they buried them, which allows the seeds to sprout and grow into new trees. Option (A) is incorrect because squirrels do not typically eat seeds. Option (C) is incorrect because squirrels do not destroy the seeds. Option (D) is incorrect because squirrels do not kill the seeds.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the role of animals in seed dispersal. A squirrel, in the tree reproduction process, plays the role of seed scatterer. Squirrels often gather and store seeds in various locations, which helps to disperse the seeds away from the parent tree and increase the chances of successful germination and growth. Option (A) is incorrect because squirrels do not eat seeds in the context of seed dispersal. Option (C) is also incorrect because squirrels do not destroy seeds in the process. Option (D) is incorrect because squirrels do not kill seeds.
